results.title: Robert's story [Subtitled]
results.creator_credit: Robert Weston, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description:
A trip down memory lane for Robert Weston as he reminisces about family, his childhood, fishing and hunting, and living on the land in the bush.
In English language with English subtitles.

results.title: Sub-igloo
results.creator_credit: Colin Low, James de B. Domville, Joseph MacInnis and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Film report from a Canadian scientific expedition that put a plastic bubble on the floor of the Arctic Ocean to serve as workshop and rest station for scientists working below the Arctic ice. What it took, in both planning and on-the-spot improvisation, to chop through the heavy ice, and to lower and anchor the huge dome in place in the dark and cold of Resolute Bay, is fully illustrated by film and commentary. Award: Bordeaux.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Colin Low, James de B. Domville, Joseph MacInnis and National Film Board of Canada
results.description: Film report from a Canadian scientific expedition that put a plastic bubble on the floor of the Arctic Ocean to serve as workshop and rest station for scientists working below the Arctic ice. What it took, in both planning and on-the-spot improvisation, to chop through the heavy ice, and to lower and anchor the huge dome in place in the dark and cold of Resolute Bay, is fully illustrated by film and commentary. Award: Bordeaux.

What it took, in both planning and on-the-spot improvisation, to chop through the heavy ice, and to lower and anchor the huge dome in place in the dark and cold of Resolute Bay, is fully illustrated by film and commentary. results.title: Leaving My Country
results.creator_credit: Grant Hood, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: An argument with his uncle one night would turn out to be a life-changing experience for Grant Hood, a proud Kurnai Gunai man. Grant mentions the importance of his meeting with Kutcha Edwards when he first arrives in Melbourne. A photo of a very young Kutcha is also shown.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Grant Hood, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Style wars
results.creator_credit: Tony Silver, Henry Chalfant and Public Art Films
results.brief_description: Examines New York’s “hiphop” subculture - the cradle of graffiti, breakdancing and rap music movements which have rocked the international worlds of art and entertainment. Cleverly juxtaposes the viewpoints of the graffiti writers, with those of law enforcement officers and government officials. Mayor Koch advocates five days in jail for repeat “graffiti” offenders and it would appear that there doesn’t seem to be much attempt by those working for the system to understand this sub-culture.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Tony Silver, Henry Chalfant and Public Art Films
results.description: Examines New York’s “hiphop” subculture - the cradle of graffiti, breakdancing and rap music movements which have rocked the international worlds of art and entertainment. Cleverly juxtaposes the viewpoints of the graffiti writers, with those of law enforcement officers and government officials. Mayor Koch advocates five days in jail for repeat “graffiti” offenders and it would appear that there doesn’t seem to be much attempt by those working for the system to understand this sub-culture.

Cleverly juxtaposes the viewpoints of the graffiti writers, with those of law enforcement officers and government officials. results.title: I'm home
results.creator_credit: Ron Briggs, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Identity is the most important thing to Ron Briggs. He talks about his father, his family and the traumatic experiences of being part of the stolen generation which separated him not only from his parents but also from his siblings.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ron Briggs, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: From the beginning to the resistances
results.creator_credit: Mick Edwards, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: ‘Me, my family, my nan - my mob.’ This is Mick Edwards’ story of separation, of a stolen generation or in Edwards’ words, “the kidnapped generation” and of healing and family and reunion.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mick Edwards, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Contentment
results.creator_credit: Noel Atkinson, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: A shearer for thirty years, Noel Atkinson’s life was turned upside down when he discovered he had Parkinson’s Disease. His new found passion in art and woodwork however has enabled him to live with this debilitating disease and provide comfort and strength in his everyday life.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Noel Atkinson, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: A shearer for thirty years, Noel Atkinson’s life was turned upside down when he discovered he had Parkinson’s Disease. His new found passion in art and woodwork however has enabled him to live with this debilitating disease and provide comfort and strength in his everyday life.

His new found passion in art and woodwork however has enabled him to live with this debilitating disease and provide comfort and strength in his everyday life.
